timeline.message:
Add JMH incredibly basic benchmark.

Currently JMH results are not ingested to anything,
this will change in future PRs.

timeline.bodyText: I don't think "-log" works any more
timeline.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText: Probably not, I'll remove it. I was just copying from existing tests.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText:
Not sure about this magic number.
Are we directly using this library file? Maybe document any modifications?
timeline.author: hui-yang

replies.bodyText: Yes as you say, this is all code that I took from cache2k and I don't know what their reasoning was for choosing it. I may just remove this because I'm not seeing a substantial difference between the memory measurement and the "settled" memory numbers.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.message:
Add JMH incredibly basic benchmark.

Currently JMH results are not ingested to anything,
this will change in future PRs.

timeline.bodyText: Why increase the time to 60 seconds?
timeline.author: fengwang666

replies.bodyText: Since this test uses mvn exec it needs to compile and then run the code. I found that this test has been occasionally failing in GitHub CI, so increasing this timeout just gives it more time to build on a slow machine. But I can definitely put it back to 30 if you want.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: So this is measuring one data point?
timeline.author: fengwang666

replies.bodyText: That's correct. If we want more data points once we have more complicated tests, then we would call this multiple times and all the data points would be averaged under the current implementation. Though we may want to change the handling to either treat them as separate data points or to aggregate them in a different way.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.bodyText: Why 60 seconds instead of default value?
timeline.author: fengwang666

replies.bodyText: I will change this. I was seeing that the kernel wasn't properly shutting down, so I tried giving it more time. Ultimately it was resolved with my change to Copier which makes them daemon threads.
replies.author: MikeDombo

timeline.message: Addressing PR comments. Adds readme. Allows multiple calls to record
